name: Lavosh
keywords: Lavosh, Lavash, Armenian Cuisine, Flatbread, Cracker, Savory Biscuit, Snack, Appetizer, Crispbread, Sesame Seeds, Black Sesame, White Sesame, Oregano, Herb Cracker, Olive Oil, Baking, Homemade Crackers, Wholemeal Flour, Vegan, Vegetarian, Dairy Free, Party Food, Charcuterie Board, Dip Accompaniment, Healthy Snack
description: A crisp and nutty Armenian-style flatbread cracker featuring a blend of plain and wholemeal flours. These thin, crunchy crackers are speckled with black and white sesame seeds and fresh oregano, making them a perfect accompaniment for dips or cheese boards.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 165C, fan forced. Cut oregano into little pieces. Combine dry ingredients, then combine wet ingredients, then combine the 2.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine ingredients

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together until a dough forms. Make sure everything is mixed through evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Form dough

recipeInstructions.text: Split into 4 and roll each one out onto a baking sheet as thin as possible. You really don't want it to be any thicker than a sesame seed. You shouldn't need baking paper because of the oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll dough

recipeInstructions.text: Before baking, lightly brush with additional olive oil and sprinkle extra salt over it. Bake for 15-20m.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake

recipeInstructions.text: Let fully cool before breaking into chunks and enjoying!
recipeInstructions.name: Enjoy

notes: Can use 1 tsp of dried oregano instead of fresh if it's easier
Rolling it thin is very important. After rolling, if you want them to be uniform cut the dough into the sizes and shapes you want.
If you rolled it too thick and it doesn't quite turn into a cracker after cooking for 15-20m, just bake for another 15-20m. It won't be as good if you roll it thin but it still works.
